title: Problem moving messages from one folder to another - possible QuickFolders problem?
creator: tcluster
content:
Hello,

I'm having a problem moving messages from one folder to another. There's one message which will not move no matter what I do. I'd like to turn off QuickFolders so that I can determine whether it causes the problem. How do I turn QuickFolders off, and then when I'm done with my experiment, turn it back on again?

title: Thunderbird says password or settings are incorrect for iCloud mail
creator: shiningprince77-firefox
content:
Thunderbird says password or settings are incorrect for iCloud mail. I have tried everything AI suggested. I use a custom domain on icloud and I have even tried using the underlying icloud address as login. Nothing works. The app password is newly generated and I tried it with and without hyphens.

Please help
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/142.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 OPR/126.0.0.0;os:Ubuntu 24.04

title: quicktest
creator: mimmogiannuoli
content: Buongiorno. Sull'ultima versione aggiornata di thunderbird (146.0.1) non c'è più compatibilità per l'opzione "quicktest". Era utilissima, per inserire testo già composto e permetteva notevole risparmio di tempo. Mi rassegno? Desisto? C'è un'alternativa valida? Grazie!
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:146.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/146.0;os:Windows 11 pro

title: Thunderbird Daily vs. Release version, subject line in bold format and email address display format
creator: bengar
content:
I recently went back from Thunderbird daily to the release channel when I set up my new PC.

1. On opening an email - The Subject display in Daily Version is Bold and according to the font as set in Thunderbird Settings. Just Perfect. It is not the same in the Release Channel. Looks not so nice.

2. In Release Channel -- under settings If I choose to display the "Name Only" under Message List for address display format. It ignores

3. Release channel is ver 146.0.1 .. If I go back to Thunderbird daily .. will I be able to use the same profile used for the Release channel?

With my thanks in advance
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/143.0.0.0 Safari/537.36
